dialogues.text: (deep and majestic) The once proud name of Frankenstein . has been dragged, by my only son, Victor, into an abyss of shame. There was a time when the name *Frankénstein' conjured dreams of virtue, of honor and devotion. Now, no guilt, no malignity, no misery can be found to equal mine. And the catalogue of sins of my once devoted son will not cease to rankle in my wounds until death shall close them forever -- so supremely frightful is the effett of any human endeavor to mock the stupendous mechanism of the Creator _ of the world.
